newsitem.title: UK: UK Labour alarmed at rail job cuts report.
newsitem.headline: UK Labour alarmed at rail job cuts report.

text.p: The opposition Labour Party on Thursday expressed alarm at newspaper reports that one of the privatised railway franchisees was planning to reduce staff by up to 40 percent in the next two years.
Transport spokesman Andrew Smith wrote to Transport Secretary Sir George Young about the reports that Regional Railways North East (RRNE) will shed more than 1,000 jobs.
"Can you give assurances that services will not suffer, and promises made in the franchise agreement will be honoured," he asked Young.
Liverpool transport group MTL was given the franchise for the RRNE earlier this month.
Newspapers said on Thursday that leaked documents from the Office of Passenger Rail Franchising had revealed the job cutting plans. -- London Newsroom +44 171 542 7767
